Shadowheart_Moonrise.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and SH in Moonrise general

Wyll_HeroAct.synopsis: Lae'zel suggests Wyll's hero act is for attention. Wyll says he can't help if his goodness made him famous.

Astarion_Steelwatch.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Astarion in Steelwatch Foundry

Gale_Stance.synopsis: Gale remarks on Laezel's battle stance. Lae'zel says it is a gith move and offers to teach him. He declines.

Wyll_FlamingFist.synopsis: Lae'zel asks to know more about these Flaming Fist. Wyll tells her what they are.

Karlach_WyrmsRock.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Karlach in Wyrms Rock

Wyll_Mizora.synopsis: Lae'zel asks Wyll about Mizora and suggests they should just kill her when you find her.

Gale_Wyll_Illithid.synopsis: Lae'zel notes that Gale knows a lot about mind flayers. He responds with information about his training. If there, Wyll chimes in as well.

Karlach_Plains.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Karlach in Plains

Gale_Purification1.synopsis: Gale asks Lae'zel about purification. What does that mean, exactly? Lae'zel mentions the Zaith'isk (device that removes it.)

Gale_BaldursMouth.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Gale in Elfsong about Baldur's Mouth

Astarion_MasonsGuild.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Astarion in Mason's Guild

Minthara_Guildhall.synopsis: Minthara and Lae'zel enter the guildhall, spoiling for a fight

Minthara_HouseOfHealing.synopsis: Minthara and Lae'zel enter an abandoned hospital. Lae'zel explains githyanki approaches to 'medicine'.

Gale_WaterqueensHouse.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Gale in Waterqueen's House

Astarion_Poem.synopsis: Lae'zel remarks on Astarion's torture-poem and admires Cazador for his cleverness. Astarion is aghast.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002.synopsis: Act 3, Shadowheart is on the Selune path

Astarion_Creche.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Astarion in Creche

Minthara_Morgue.synopsis: Lae'zel and Minthara enter a morgue full of hideous experiments

Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and SH in at the Moonrise Bridge when approaching Moonrise

Wyll_Dangers.synopsis: Lae'zel suggests she might have underestimated the dangers of Faerun. Wyll tells her she doesn't know the half of it.

Gale_BloomridgePark.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Gale in Bloomridge Park

Gale_MoonriseOubliette.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Glae in Moonrise Oubliette

Karlach_OskarsBeloved.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Karlach in Jaheira's/Oskar's Beloved

Gale_Dialect.synopsis: Lae'zel mocks Gale for always talking like an old tome. He responds with a quite loquacious insult.

Shadowheart_Weapon.synopsis: Party discovered gith are after the weapon-cube-thing. Lae'zel asks SH what she is hiding.

Minthara_Act3_ROM_001.synopsis: Act 3, Shadowheart is on the Selune path

Gale_UpperTracks.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Gale in Harborview Park/Upper Tracks

Gale_TadpolingCenter.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Gale in the Illithid Colony (Tadpoling Center)

Minthara_Act2_ROM_001.synopsis: Act 3, Shadowheart is on the Selune path

Gale_Rivington.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Gale in Rivington

Gale_FelogyrsFireworks.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Gale in Felogyr's Fireworks

Wyll_Creche.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Wyll in Creche

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001.synopsis: Act 3, Shadowheart is on the Shar path

Gale_AbandonedHouse.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Gale in Abandoned House

Shadowheart_Peace.synopsis: Lae'zel remarks on Shadowheart's battle prowess. Shadowheart is surprised at a compliment from Lae'zel. Lae'zel says it is an observation, not a compliment

Minthara_NorthAlleys.synopsis: Lae'zel talks about her home - an asteroid - and Minthara is curious abotu it

Astarion_Vampire.synopsis: Lae'zel tells Astarion to do what he needs - but he better keep his fangs off her. He gets quippy but deflective. (Deflective?)

Shadowheart_LastLightCursed.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and SH in Last Light (cursed)

Wyll_GeneralSewers.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Wyll in the Sewers (General)

Gale_Astral.synopsis: Lae'zel asks Gale what is interest is in the astral plane, and he equivocates.

Halsin_Act3_ROM_001.synopsis: Banter between Lae'zel and Halsin in Act 3 in cases where the player (not speaking here) is in a romance with Halsin.

Gale_Shadowheart_Vlaakith.synopsis: Gale asks Lae'zel about the lich queen Vlaakith. Lae'zel says she is as fearsome as he heard. If Shadowheart is there, she thinks Vlaakith sounds more gross than fearsome.

Gale_Purification2.synopsis: Gale follows up on previous purification discussion. What is this device, exactly? Lae'zel says she can say no more, by covenant.

Karlach_Battlefield.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Karlach in Battlefield

Shadowheart_PreFight.synopsis: Lae'zel tells Shadowheart her suspicions are tiring. Shadowheart says they are necessary.

Wyll_EasternDocks.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Wyll at the Eastern Docks (Sahuagin)

Minthara_IllithidColony.synopsis: Laezel and Minthara talk together in a mindflayer colony

Astarion_MoonriseAssault.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Astarion in Moonrise during the Assault state

Minthara_SCLForest.synopsis: Minthara and Lae'zel explore a cursed forest

Astarion_IllithidColony.synopsis: Party Banter for Laezel and Astarion in Illithid Colony (General)

Shadowheart_Moonrise_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_Moonrise_0.text: I itch to draw my weapon and gut every last one of these cultists.

Shadowheart_Moonrise_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Moonrise_2.text: You're keen. Just don't get carried away - some of those guts might be of more use to us unspilled, at least for a while.

Shadowheart_Moonrise_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_Moonrise_1.text: I know better than to indulge every craving, Shadowheart. But when the time is right, the Absolutists will feel the sting of my blade.

Wyll_HeroAct_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_HeroAct_1.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hm? Do you always need to be the centre of attention?

Wyll_HeroAct_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_HeroAct_0.text: Anything but. I don't fight to be flattered, Lae'zel. I fight to save lives.

Astarion_Steelwatch_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Steelwatch_0.text: These Steel Watchers are impressive achievements. Worthy opponents, even for githyanki.

Astarion_Steelwatch_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Steelwatch_2.text: In that case, I'll leave fighting them to you. So I can observe your technique.

Astarion_Steelwatch_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Steelwatch_1.text: I'm sure you'll find it instructive. Or do you simply want to avoid risking your pallid neck?

Astarion_Steelwatch_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Steelwatch_3.text: Perish the thought - we're comrades in arms! I will be right behind you.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Karlach, were there others of Zariel's warriors who bore the infernal engine?

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: I was the first - not the last. But most didn't survive the process.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_4.text: The others were all devilkin. I think I was the only lucky winner from Faerûn.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_3.text: You were stronger than the others.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: A dinner date. At first your request confused me. But then, I became curious...

Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: Think you might like to try it for yourself some time?

Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: Well. Good thing for us both I make for riveting company.

Gale_Stance_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Stance_0.text: Your prowess in battle is remarkable, as is your battle stance itself.

Gale_Stance_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Stance_2.text: Hrath ajak - a technique known to few outside K'liir. Shall I teach you?
Gale_Stance_2.context: NodeContext: heh-RATH ah-JAHK. A gith battle stance.

Gale_Stance_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Stance_1.text: I'll pass, thank you. I prefer Abjuration over acrobatics.

Wyll_FlamingFist_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_FlamingFist_1.text: I've not heard of these 'Flaming Fist'. Enlighten me, Wyll.

Wyll_FlamingFist_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_FlamingFist_3.text: The Coast's chief militia, led by none other than Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard himself.

Karlach_WyrmsRock_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_WyrmsRock_0.text: A kith'rak's red dragon would have this place down around Gortash's ears in moments.

Karlach_WyrmsRock_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_WyrmsRock_2.text: I'd love to see that. I've always hated this place.

Karlach_WyrmsRock_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_WyrmsRock_1.text: It will be far more satisfying to plunge a blade into Gortash myself than to pick through his ashes.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: How do you maintain such an elaborate plait, Shadowheart? The craftsmanship is impressive.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_2.text: Now that you mention it, I can't remember who taught me. Another memory lost, perhaps.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_2.context: NodeContext: Early game/SH still loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: Still. If you let me watch your technique, I might learn it from you.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_3.text: Maybe. If you keep a respectable distance.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_3.context: NodeContext: Early game/SH still loyal to Shar

Wyll_Mizora_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_Mizora_0.text: If you wish to be rid of your devil, Wyll, we should just kill her and be done with it.

Wyll_Mizora_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Mizora_1.text: And incur the wrath of the Hells? I might as well just leap straight into the fires.

Gale_Wyll_Illithid_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Wyll_Illithid_0.text: You strike me cleverer than most istiki, Gale. Multiple tutors, I should guess.

Gale_Wyll_Illithid_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_Wyll_Illithid_2.text: Many a wise man and woman indeed. Waterdeep is the home of myriad scholars.

Gale_Wyll_Illithid_1.speaker: Wyll
Gale_Wyll_Illithid_1.text: Ah, the City of Splendours. Spent a whole Fleetswake there with my father. What a delight.

Karlach_Plains_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_Plains_0.text: Smell that? Blood. This whole plain reeks of it.

Karlach_Plains_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Plains_2.text: That'll wake you up of a fine day, won't it.

Karlach_Plains_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_Plains_1.text: I do not need awakening. My senses are sharp as steel.

Gale_Purification1_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Purification1_0.text: Tell me, Lae'zel, when you say we might be 'purified' at your crèche, what does that mean exactly?

Gale_Purification1_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Purification1_1.text: A ghustil will affix the zaith'isk, the purifier, to our heads.

Gale_Purification1_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Purification1_2.text: Its magic will quell the parasite in an instant.

Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Does your species release airborne pheromones upon beginning the courtship dance, Wyll?

Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: I've heard thus is the way with certain birds of paradise and prey. The chemical induces lowered inhibitions between the pair.

Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_3.text: No. I mean, I don't think so. Would you count a light spritz from a vial of jasmine dust as a pheromone?

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: To bind oneself to another forever seems a fool's vow.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: Then by all means, call me a fool.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: In the Gate especially, it's uncommon to marry your first love nowadays.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: But losing that early love is still the regret foremost of forgotten sorrows.

Gale_BaldursMouth_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_BaldursMouth_0.text: Drink, dance, and song. Tu'narath's residents are known to partake in all three. Substantially.

Gale_BaldursMouth_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_BaldursMouth_3.text: Is that so? I assumed there to be little time for frivolity amongst all the fighting.

Gale_BaldursMouth_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_BaldursMouth_1.text: Eternity is long, Gale. Long enough to pursue endeavours beyond combat.

Gale_BaldursMouth_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_BaldursMouth_2.text: Githyanki write symphonies, craft liquors, paint frescos. When they aren't in fierce battle with ghaik, of course.

Astarion_MasonsGuild_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_MasonsGuild_0.text: 'Mason's Guild'. The githyanki would call this a or'mlar: an alliance of mlar.

Astarion_MasonsGuild_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_MasonsGuild_2.text: Builders, craftspeople - and the makers of the incomparable silver swords the kith'raki wield in battle.

Astarion_MasonsGuild_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_MasonsGuild_1.text: The mlar may not be warriors, but they are no less valuable to my people.

Astarion_Act3_002_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Act3_002_0.text: You have shared your new power with your lover, Astarion. I'm surprised - I expected you to turn your back once you got what you wanted.

Astarion_Act3_002_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Act3_002_1.text: Quite the opposite - I need someone I can trust. And now I know they'll never betray me.

Minthara_Guildhall_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_Guildhall_2.text: Two sides, each itching to draw blades against the other.

Minthara_Guildhall_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_Guildhall_0.text: The sensation is contagious. Which should we oppose?
Minthara_Guildhall_0.context: NodeContext: in the thieve's guild, having witnessed tension between two factions and hoping to fight. 'The sensation' she refers to is people 'itching to draw their blades'.

Minthara_Guildhall_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_Guildhall_1.text: Either or both, so long as I get to spill blood.

Minthara_HouseOfHealing_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_HouseOfHealing_3.text: A waste of space and resources. Gith triage methods obviate the need for such crude facilities.

Minthara_HouseOfHealing_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_HouseOfHealing_2.text: A githyanki ghustil can summon Astral energy to heal most any wound.

Minthara_HouseOfHealing_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_HouseOfHealing_1.text: If a warrior's lacerations are beyond even their ability, the victim is beheaded.

Minthara_HouseOfHealing_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_HouseOfHealing_0.text: Efficient. We have much to learn from one another.

Gale_WaterqueensHouse_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_WaterqueensHouse_0.text: Githyanki gish sail skiffs through the Astral Sea, an ocean far larger than Umberlee's.

Gale_WaterqueensHouse_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_WaterqueensHouse_3.text: Does the Astral Sea come with an equally irritable goddess?

Gale_WaterqueensHouse_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_WaterqueensHouse_1.text: Vlaakith holds dominion over the entire plane. And she is not 'irritable' - she is ruthless.

Gale_WaterqueensHouse_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_WaterqueensHouse_2.text: Vlaakith holds dominion over the entire plane. And 'irritable' does not even begin to describe her.

Astarion_Poem_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Poem_0.text: Poetry as torture - your master's quite clever, Astarion. Don't you agree?

Astarion_Poem_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Poem_1.text: You and I have very different definitions of 'clever'.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.text: I find the locals' fascination with 'the beach' is but a conspiracy for prudes to leer at each other unquestioned.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_3.text: Why does anyone bother wearing swim-garments at all?

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.text: I'm not inclined to bother, myself, but I suppose it keeps the City Watch at bay.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.context: NodeContext: 'It is what it is'. Arc: SH has turned from Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.text: Some act as though displaying bare flesh is a more heinous crime than murder and robbery.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.context: NodeContext: 'It is what it is'. Arc: SH has turned from Shar

Astarion_Creche_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Creche_0.text: We are permitted to walk so freely. Such a lack of discipline would be punished severely in K'liir.

Astarion_Creche_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Creche_3.text: Walk freely? This place is as tight as a patriar's purse.

Astarion_Creche_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Creche_2.text: We should have been disarmed on entry. I'm pleased we weren't, but it's strange.

Astarion_Creche_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Creche_1.text: No doubt they found me too intimidating.

Minthara_Morgue_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_Morgue_2.text: I have seen many a gruesome death, but even I can't fathom some of the horrors inflicted in this supposed 'House of Healing'.

Minthara_Morgue_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_Morgue_0.text: You're young, child. If you survive as long as I have, you will witness greater horrors than this.
Minthara_Morgue_0.context: NodeContext: explaining harsh truths to Lae'zel, like a mother to a teenage daughter. A little condescending, but kind in her intentions

Minthara_Morgue_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_Morgue_1.text: If you are fortunate, you may even inflict greater horrors in the name of your cause.
Minthara_Morgue_1.context: NodeContext: with relish and heavy emphasis on 'inflict' because she's shifting from 'witnessing' horrors in the previous node ot inflicting them in this one

Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_0.text: Moonrise Towers at last. Make no mistake - I will have answers about these ghaik tadpoles.

Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_3.text: Easy, Lae'zel - we need answers, yes, but you catch more flies with honey than vinegar...

Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_2.text: ... perhaps that doesn't translate. I don't know if githyanki have honey. Or vinegar. Or flies, even. Let's just show some restraint.
Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_2.context: NodeContext: On second though/a little amused that the colloquialism mightn't translate.

Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_MoonriseApproach_1.text: I'm capable of restraint, just as you're capable of raw fury. I trust we'll find reason to exercise both here.

Wyll_Dangers_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_Dangers_0.text: Every moment a new danger. I may have underestimated this Faerûn.

Wyll_Dangers_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Dangers_1.text: You don't know the half of it. With a bit of luck, we'll meet a beholder.

Gale_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.text: So, Lae'zel - have you ever been tempted to use psionics in your, erm, romantic endeavours?
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: Curiosity winning out over awkwardness

Gale_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_ROM_Act2_1.text: Only once. Did you know, In low-gravity settings, githyanki can maintain aerial suspension for hours at a time?

Gale_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_0.text: Fascinating - I think the archmage Tasha described a spell with similar effect. I really must look that up...
Gale_ROM_Act2_0.context: NodeContext: Latter part almost to self. Tasha as in 'Natasha'

Gale_BloomridgePark_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_BloomridgePark_1.text: These children and their pets lack discipline. Were they githyanki, I'd recommend further training.

Gale_BloomridgePark_4.speaker: Gale
Gale_BloomridgePark_4.text: Not everyone approaches the raising of their young with such militaristic vigour.
Gale_BloomridgePark_4.context: NodeContext: Attempting to defend the children Lae'zel is criticising, in a conciliatory way

Gale_BloomridgePark_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_BloomridgePark_3.text: That is the very purpose of training - to determine which children shall be warriors, and which are suited to other roles.

Gale_BloomridgePark_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_BloomridgePark_0.text: As for the unruly animals - they would make for nutritious marching rations.

Gale_BloomridgePark_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_BloomridgePark_2.text: That's certainly one way to make them behave...
Gale_BloomridgePark_2.context: NodeContext: Not sure what to say - Lae'zel suggested eating the children's pets

Gale_MoonriseOubliette_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_MoonriseOubliette_0.text: The right of these prisoners to die in mortal combat was stolen from them.

Gale_MoonriseOubliette_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonriseOubliette_2.text: Hardly the worst atrocity the Absolute's committed.

Gale_MoonriseOubliette_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_MoonriseOubliette_1.text: One of many, but by no means the least. To die properly is a matter of honour.

Karlach_OskarsBeloved_3.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_OskarsBeloved_3.text: Phew! Wouldn't mind shacking up in a place like this.

Karlach_OskarsBeloved_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_OskarsBeloved_0.text: Yes  - and quite an attractive target for githyanki raiders. They'd plunder the village and fly off with the spoils.

Karlach_OskarsBeloved_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_OskarsBeloved_2.text: To my people, all the planes are a vast garden to be weeded and picked.

Karlach_OskarsBeloved_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_OskarsBeloved_1.text: Well tell your mates to keep their hoes out of Baldur's Gate.

Gale_Dialect_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Dialect_0.text: You've a particular way with words, Gale. Perhaps oration suits you more than battle.

Gale_Dialect_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Dialect_1.text: They're not mutually exclusive. The Weave is served best with a dash of eloquence.

Shadowheart_Weapon_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_Weapon_0.text: The traitor kith'rak takes great interest in this relic of yours, Shadowheart. Or should I say... weapon.

Shadowheart_Weapon_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Weapon_1.text: Nothing. I assume your kin are just as misguided as you are.

Minthara_Act3_ROM_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_Act3_ROM_001_0.text: At what age do you think it is right to set a child upon mortal combat?

Minthara_Act3_ROM_001_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_Act3_ROM_001_2.text: The moment it can hold a blade. It may even test its resilience against some common poisons while it is still in the womb.

Minthara_Act3_ROM_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_Act3_ROM_001_1.text: Tsk'va. We do not wilfully risk our young until they are of thirteen years. No point wasting battle-flesh before it's primed.

Gale_UpperTracks_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_UpperTracks_0.text: These flowers are quite vivid - not to mention, pungent. Not to my liking.

Gale_UpperTracks_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_UpperTracks_2.text: Are there no flowers in Tu'narath?

Gale_UpperTracks_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_UpperTracks_1.text: In the City of Death, the mlar cultivate the fruiting bodies that sprout from the corpses of the slain.

Gale_UpperTracks_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_UpperTracks_3.text: I'd rather get them from my florist in Waterdeep, if it's all the same to you.
Gale_UpperTracks_3.context: NodeContext: trying to be polite, maintain light conversation - what the hell did Lae'zel just tell him?

Astarion_ROM_Act2_002_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_ROM_Act2_002_0.text: The more I learn of this plane, Astarion, the more I believe 'love' is its greatest disease.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_002_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act2_002_1.text: Oh, I don't know. The screaming fever is pretty bad.

Gale_TadpolingCenter_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_TadpolingCenter_0.text: A tadpole nursery, as on the nautiloid. We must not leave it intact.

Gale_TadpolingCenter_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_TadpolingCenter_2.text: Quite right. So long as the attempt won't leave us similarly dismantled...
Gale_TadpolingCenter_2.context: NodeContext: Slightly apprehensive, not sure what Lae'zel is planning

Gale_TadpolingCenter_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_TadpolingCenter_1.text: Caution is commendable. Boldness is extraordinary. In this case, I recommend the latter.

Gale_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_1.text: Indulge me, Lae'zel. As someone unfettered by Faerûnian beauty standards, how would you appraise my appearance?
Gale_ROM_Act1_1.context: NodeContext: Hoping for a positive assessment

Gale_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_ROM_Act1_0.text: Your beard looks like the hairy tufts upon the psurlon, the largest of wormkind that slither our skies.

Gale_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_2.text: I suppose that's a bad thing? No - don't answer that.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: Wyll, you are a man of great vigour. Why have you not sought a mate any of these nights we have camped?

Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: Ah, well, I admit I've had thoughts about it. In my own way.

Minthara_Act2_ROM_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_Act2_ROM_001_0.text: Our leader is a fool for love, Minthara. I'd never be compelled to conduct such a poorly-planned jailbreak.

Minthara_Act2_ROM_001_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_Act2_ROM_001_2.text: They did not do it for love. They did it for my prowess in combat, as well as coitus. I excel in both.

Minthara_Act2_ROM_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_Act2_ROM_001_1.text: As do I. Sometimes the acts are not dissimilar.

Gale_Rivington_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Rivington_0.text: Cowards at every turn in this community. In githyanki society, they would be retrained - or culled.

Gale_Rivington_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_Rivington_2.text: Condoning the slaughter of the weak? Not the most charitable perspective to take.
Gale_Rivington_2.context: NodeContext: A bit surprised, this is heartless even for Lae'zel

Gale_Rivington_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Rivington_1.text: I am observing, not condoning. A meaningful difference.

Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_1.text: Fireworks - a particularly gnomish field of art, no?

Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_3.text: Indeed. More than simple craft, it's a way of life for some of them.
Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_3.context: NodeContext: Not realising she's about to crack a joke, taking the question seriously

Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_2.text: That may explain why most gnomes possess such short fuses.

Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_4.speaker: Gale
Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_4.context: NodeContext: Utter disbelief - a  joke from a relentlessly serious character

Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_FelogyrsFireworks_0.text: Only if you found it funny.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: Your years in the Hells have made you a fierce warrior, Karlach.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: Fierce in battle, maybe a bit naive in... everything else.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_3.text: In that way, you are like many a young githyanki - wise to the ways of battle, if not to the wider world.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_4.text: Makes sense. And how are you getting on out here in the world?

Wyll_Creche_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_Creche_0.text: How I have longed for these familiar sounds and sights.

Wyll_Creche_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Creche_2.text: Well I'll be. So even the ferocious Lae'zel has a soft side.

Wyll_Creche_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_Creche_1.text: A possessive side. What is a warrior without something precious to protect?

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: You are debating allowing another into your heart.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Quite the gossip, aren't you? Wouldn't have thought you cared.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_2.context: NodeContext: Applicable to either SH arc. Referring to a burgeoning romance with the player

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: A formidable woman like yourself does herself no favours in revealing herself to be so erratic, so... uncertain.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: I heard a curious sound in the night. What would you know about that, Shadowheart?

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: Lady Shar permits me to plead ignorance.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_3.context: NodeContext: Coy. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: I ask not of Lady Shar - but of you and your paramour.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: I haven't the faintest idea what you mean. Perhaps a cat pounced on its prey?
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_1.context: NodeContext: Coy. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Gale_AbandonedHouse_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_AbandonedHouse_0.text: What is this...? This place makes me feel sad. Melancholy.

Gale_AbandonedHouse_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_AbandonedHouse_2.text: Ah, so you're susceptible to the tragedy of a broken home. Maybe you've more in common with us weaker beings than you thought...
Gale_AbandonedHouse_2.context: NodeContext: Toying with her, likes that she's opened up about this

Gale_AbandonedHouse_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_AbandonedHouse_1.text: There's no call to be insulting.

Shadowheart_Peace_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_Peace_1.text: I've been watching you fight, Shadowheart. Your skills are improving.

Shadowheart_Peace_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Peace_0.text: My skills were just fine to begin with. You can save the compliments.

Shadowheart_Peace_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_Peace_2.text: I don't pay compliments. I make observations.

Minthara_NorthAlleys_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_NorthAlleys_0.text: Ah - the smell of fresh blood spilled on stone. It reminds me of the tunnels within my home of K'liir.

Minthara_NorthAlleys_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_NorthAlleys_3.text: I would like to visit your home one day, Lae'zel. Where is K'liir?
Minthara_NorthAlleys_3.context: NodeContext: curious and friendly - keh-LEAR, the name of Lae'zel's home

Minthara_NorthAlleys_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_NorthAlleys_1.text: You may know it as Stardock. An asteroid, one of the Tears of Selûne. It's tunnels are home to all manner of creatures to hunt.

Minthara_NorthAlleys_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_NorthAlleys_2.text: Vicious, unrelenting. The sort of place I imagine you'd take to, Minthara.

Astarion_Vampire_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Vampire_1.text: But give me so much as a hungry look, and I'll drive a stake through your heart.

Astarion_Vampire_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Vampire_0.text: Ooh, I do so very like spicy food.

Shadowheart_LastLightCursed_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_LastLightCursed_0.text: Last Light's defenders - slaughtered, every last one.

Shadowheart_LastLightCursed_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_LastLightCursed_1.text: They were arrogant enough to try and withstand Lady Shar's power. This was always going to be the end result.
Shadowheart_LastLightCursed_1.context: NodeContext: 'They didn't deserve this' = SH turned from Shar. 'They were arrogant' = SH loyal to Shar

Wyll_GeneralSewers_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_GeneralSewers_0.text: Baldur's Gate's sewer system could use a few... improvements.

Wyll_GeneralSewers_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_GeneralSewers_2.text: The smell getting to you, Lae'zel?

Wyll_GeneralSewers_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_GeneralSewers_1.text: It isn't the smell that bothers me - it's the inefficiency. An entire underground wasted on waste that could simply be teleported to Wildspace.

Wyll_GeneralSewers_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_GeneralSewers_3.text: Hm. Once the Absolute's finished, I'll be sure to propose your idea to the Council.

Gale_Astral_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Astral_2.text: Tell me, Gale: what is your interest in the Astral Plane?

Gale_Astral_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Astral_0.text: Time. Or rather: the absence of it. In the Astral Plane, everything is eternal.

Gale_Astral_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Astral_1.text: It will be my home soon enough, should Vlaakith will it.

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: Why have you not tried to lay with me, Astarion?

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_3.text: It is in your nature to have tried. You have not.

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: No, and you're so charming and alluring. It's baffling, really.
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_1.context: NodeContext: Responding to Lae'zel's very blunt demeanour

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_2.text: I guess it shall remain a mystery, now and forevermore.

Astarion_Act3_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Act3_001_0.text: Astarion, I note you and your lover struggle to keep your hands off one another.

Astarion_Act3_001_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_Act3_001_2.text: It makes you less watchful. We're panting after battle, and already your maws are glued.

Astarion_Act3_001_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Act3_001_1.text: We're having fun. I would say 'try it, it won't kill you', but in your case I'm not sure.

Halsin_Act3_ROM_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Halsin_Act3_ROM_001_0.text: You've quite the appetite, Halsin. I'd wager you've bedded more of your foes than you've felled.

Halsin_Act3_ROM_001_2.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Act3_ROM_001_2.text: Hmm. A challenging sum. The chimera has three heads... but does it still count as one?

Halsin_Act3_ROM_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Halsin_Act3_ROM_001_1.text: Must have been a challenging kill.

Halsin_Act3_ROM_001_3.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Act3_ROM_001_3.context: NodeContext: 'Yep, that's definitely what I meant'

Gale_Shadowheart_Vlaakith_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Shadowheart_Vlaakith_0.text: I was wondering about your queen, Vlaakith. What tales of her reach us are terrifying, but I suppose that's not how you would describe her.

Gale_Shadowheart_Vlaakith_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Shadowheart_Vlaakith_2.text: Vlaakith is unity: fear and beauty, life and unlife. Eyes like onyx, teeth like daggers. There is none more perfect.

Gale_Shadowheart_Vlaakith_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_Shadowheart_Vlaakith_1.text: Sounds vile. I assume the meaning of 'perfect' was lost in translation...

Gale_Purification2_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Purification2_0.text: That zaith'isk you mentioned intrigues me. Care to tell me a bit more?

Gale_Purification2_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_Purification2_1.text: An intricate device, crafted by mlar - our most gifted artisans. I am sworn to say no more.

Karlach_Battlefield_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_Battlefield_0.text: Bones. Rusted weapons. A great battle was fought here.

Karlach_Battlefield_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Battlefield_2.text: An extra vicious one, I think. No one buried their dead.

Karlach_Battlefield_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_Battlefield_1.text: Exactly the sort of battle I live to fight. And the sort made even more thrilling with a hot-hearted tiefling at my side.

Shadowheart_PreFight_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_PreFight_0.text: Your sour face is tiring, Shadowheart. By all means leave, if I am so distasteful.

Shadowheart_PreFight_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_PreFight_1.text: I'd rather not turn my back on you, if it's all the same.

Wyll_EasternDocks_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_EasternDocks_1.text: I smell danger on the wind. Keep your weapons ready.

Wyll_EasternDocks_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_EasternDocks_3.text: The only thing the wind's carrying is the smell of trout. Lae'zel. We're near the fish market.

Wyll_EasternDocks_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Wyll_EasternDocks_2.text: Discount my warning at your peril.

Wyll_EasternDocks_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_EasternDocks_0.text: I get it, Lae'zel - peril, danger, and so forth. All I can think of now is a nice fish dinner.

Shadowheart_MountainPass_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_MountainPass_1.text: I believe we're approaching the crèche. Once we're inside, let me do the talking.

Shadowheart_MountainPass_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MountainPass_3.text: Just to be clear - you're going to lead us into a nest of githyanki marauders, and we're supposed to trust that will end well for us?

Shadowheart_MountainPass_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MountainPass_2.text: More a sign of the times, I suppose.
Shadowheart_MountainPass_2.context: NodeContext: 'Oh well, no time for regrets now'

Minthara_IllithidColony_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_IllithidColony_0.text: A ghaik colony. Illithids are certainly the driving force behind this Absolute cult.

Minthara_IllithidColony_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_IllithidColony_1.text: The hierarchy of command is not yet clear, child. Can you be sure the illithids are in control?
Minthara_IllithidColony_1.context: NodeContext: the 'child' is Lae'zel, who isn't a child, but Minthara thinks of her as one since the age difference is so vast. She's fond of Lae'zel and is trying to educate her in strategy.

Minthara_IllithidColony_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_IllithidColony_2.text: I know what I see - my mortal enemies. And I know what must be done about them.

Astarion_MoonriseAssault_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_MoonriseAssault_0.text: At last, we wash our weapons in Absolute blood.

Astarion_MoonriseAssault_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_MoonriseAssault_2.text: I like this bloodlust look on you. Very flattering.

Astarion_MoonriseAssault_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_MoonriseAssault_1.text: Even now, at the cusp, you waste your breath on prattle.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_1.text: Ready your weapons. This will not be resolved by wits alone.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_3.text: You're right - though I like to think my wits are the best weapon I have.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_0.text: Your high regard for your own wits is no secret to anyone.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_2.text: Touché, Lae'zel! Perhaps wits are contagious.

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: Gale, I've heard you talking in your sleep. Your mate needs better rest for our journey.

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: And deprive them of the pleasure of hearing my nocturnal postulations? I'd never be so cruel.

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: The mind absorbs much while we believe ourselves dormant. To lie beside Gale of Waterdeep is positively educational.

Minthara_SCLForest_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_SCLForest_3.text: Difficult terrain, cursed or not. Gith dragon-riders prefer flat land and open skies.

Minthara_SCLForest_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_SCLForest_1.text: Ketheric's undead legions carve paths through the foliage when they pass. It grows back stronger though.
Minthara_SCLForest_1.context: NodeContext: describing this bitterly - she hates Ketheric

Minthara_SCLForest_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Minthara_SCLForest_0.text: A tedious labour well suited to the undead.

Minthara_SCLForest_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_SCLForest_2.text: Tedious labour does not only suit the dead. Plenty of surface-dwellers are suitable for little else.
Minthara_SCLForest_2.context: NodeContext: sneering - she has no respect for surface-dwellers (meaning those are not from the underdark)

Astarion_IllithidColony_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_IllithidColony_0.text: We must be ready to confront the elder brain. One presides over every ghaik colony.

Astarion_IllithidColony_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_IllithidColony_2.text: No problem. And what does this old brain look like?

Astarion_IllithidColony_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Astarion_IllithidColony_1.text: A hovering mass of grey matter, sprouted with lethal tentacles and oozing cerebrospinal fluid.

Astarion_IllithidColony_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_IllithidColony_3.context: NodeContext: Just been brought down to earth - he's going to face a fearsome monster
